metadata.notes: Famous 'Shark Squadron' - first Allied unit to use shark mouth nose art on P-40s. Transitioned from Tomahawks to Kittyhawks December 1941. Squadron operated mixed Kittyhawk variants during Q4 1942: Mk IA (P-40E-1) and Mk III (P-40M/P-40K-1). Aircraft codes used GA-? prefix (e.g., ET790 GA-? Billy Drake's mount, ET789 GA-C, AK772 GA-Y 'London Pride'). Squadron moved multiple times during El Alamein and subsequent pursuit operations. Billy Drake succeeded Clive Caldwell (highest-scoring Australian ace) as CO in May 1942. Personnel included pilots from Poland, Australia, Canada, New Zealand. Squadron used Kittyhawks as fighter-bombers for remainder of Desert Air Force operations.
